Node.definition: = state in which humans or animals, whether male or female, are unable to procreate
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= action by which humans shout ◄ for joy or because of grief ► to give vent to their feelings

= process by which human have painful contractions of the womb, ◄ which is caused by an advanced state of pregnancy ► and results in birth of new offspring; ≈ associated with anguish, trembling, suffering, and fear
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= action by which a man takes a woman as his lawful wife

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities increase the size of an area or object
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary
= long strip ◄ of cloth, usually made out of goat's hair or linen, ► sewn together to form larger pieces of cloth used as covering for a tent or for separating one room from another
= temporary construction ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, shepherds, etc.
literally: to stretch out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities causes an area to be covered with something with the shape and the flexibility of a large piece of cloth
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen with less intensity
= to cause something to increase in length
= relatively thin piece of stout cord; ◄ made by twisting together palm fibers, linen, or reeds; ► especially used as tent cord or bowstring
= small, pointed object ► driven into a wall or the ground and used for hanging things on or securing something in place; ≈ associated with firmness and security
= causative action by which humans ensure that an object cannot be moved from its place
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= the side of the human body which is to the north when facing the direction of the rising sun; in extension: one option as opposed to another
= process by which humans and objects quickly increase in quantity and take up increasingly more space
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= causative action by which humans or deities take over the ownership of land from other humans, which usually implies that the former owners are driven away

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to make a certain place or area their home

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done
= process by which humans experience a strong emotion of shame
= state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= state in which humans are still relatively young; ≈ associated with strength but also with reckless living
= state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people
= state in which women have lost their husband, ► which requires them to wear widow's clothing; ≈ associated with disgrace

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= action by which a man takes a woman as his lawful wife
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to be emotionally hurt or troubled
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= the period of a person's life between childhood and adulthood
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= a very short length of time
= state in which an event is of short duration
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
= state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals to come together as a group for a common purpose
= process by which humans or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

literally: to hide (one's) face (from someone); hence: = action by which a deity does not engage with people, and does not intervene neither in their favor nor to punish, ◄ as if he were enable to see them
= a very short length of time

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man; ◄ son of Lamech (לֶמֶךְ) descendant of Seth (שֵׁת) ► father of Shem (שֵׁם) Ham (חָם) Japheth (יֶפֶת)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true
= man; ◄ son of Lamech (לֶמֶךְ) descendant of Seth (שֵׁת) ► father of Shem (שֵׁם) Ham (חָם) Japheth (יֶפֶת)

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true
= process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law
= action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= process by which an object moves away from its location
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
literally: to detach itself (from a someone or somewhere); hence: = process by which a certain event stops taking place
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
= state in which a condition that has been in place for a considerable amount of time is about to come to an end

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
used in poetry only: = causative action by which humans cause an object to be located in a certain place
= a brittle silvery white semimetal; ≈ regarded as valuable and beautiful
= block of stone, whether fully square or not;◄ found in nature or hewn from a quarry; ► used for building houses, walls, and other constructions
= causative action by which humans put in place the bottom part of a building or larger structure, usually below the ground level, which will have to bear the entire construction
= (semi )precious stone with a deep blue color, possibly sapphire
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = precious stone with a bright red color
= small object ◄ consisting of a variety of stone that is considered precious because of its beauty and scarcity; ► used as ornament or decoration; ≈ association with honor, majesty, and glory
exact meaning unsure: = precious stone, probably with a fiery glow
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= small object ◄ consisting of a variety of stone that is considered precious because of its beauty and scarcity; ► used as ornament or decoration; ≈ association with honor, majesty, and glory
= state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to objects
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= person who receives instruction from someone else for a relatively long period
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
literally: to be established; hence: = process by which humans find security and stability

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to lack inner strength and courage
= process by which a moment in time is about to happen
= process by which humans plan aggression or war against other humans
= process by which humans plan aggression or war against other humans
= state of non existence of a person, place or event

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= process by which humans plan aggression or war against other humans
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are killed or severely wounded by enemies
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before
= person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
literally: to bring out from; hence: = causative process by which humans carry out a certain procedure which results in a new product
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before

Node.gloss: to destroy|to ruin|to devastate|to break|to harm
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone brings destruction and suffering upon humans and inanimate objects
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= process by which an event is completed with the expected or satisfactory outcome
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge

Node.gloss: to declare guilty|to condemn as guilty
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans guilty before God or humanity, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
